definitions.definition: To place on or into a physical location.
examples: The statue is situated in a corner hardly visible to the public, except through a window from an outside maintenance area situated behind the building.

definitions.definition: To place or put into an intangible place or position, such as social, ethical, fictional, etc.
examples: The mayor is situated between probable censure and possible recall.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To place on or into a physical location.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , figurative ) To place or put into an intangible place or position, such as social, ethical, fictional, etc.
